Purpose

This repository serves as the single source of truth for all eastsidehealthcare website development guidelines. Instead of maintaining duplicate documentation across multiple repositories, all projects reference these master guidelines.

üìö

Centralized Documentation

One place for all guidelines. Updates propagate to all projects automatically when they reference these master files.

üîÑ

Consistent Standards

Ensure all websites follow the same SEO, UI, and workflow standards. No more inconsistent implementations across projects.

‚ö°

Fast Updates

When guidelines change, update them once here instead of in multiple repositories. All projects benefit immediately.

Usage

All projects should reference these guidelines rather than maintaining local copies.

In Your Project README or Docs

## Development Guidelines

Refer to the master instructions repository for:
- [SEO Guidelines](https://github.com/eastsidehealthcare/master-instructions/blob/main/docs/SEO-GUIDELINES.md)
- [UI Guidelines](https://github.com/eastsidehealthcare/master-instructions/blob/main/docs/UI-GUIDELINES.md)  
- [Workflow Guidelines](https://github.com/eastsidehealthcare/master-instructions/blob/main/docs/MASTER-WORKFLOW.md)

Frequently Asked Questions

Common questions about the master instructions repository.

Why create a separate repository for guidelines?

Centralizing guidelines ensures consistency across all projects. When we update SEO requirements or UI patterns, we only need to update them once in the master repository instead of in every project repository. This prevents inconsistencies and makes maintenance much easier.

How do projects reference these guidelines?

Projects should include links to the master instructions in their README or documentation. They should NOT maintain local copies of SEO-GUIDELINES.md or UI-GUIDELINES.md files. Instead, they should link to the master versions in this repository.

What if a project needs project-specific guidelines?

Project-specific guidelines can be maintained in the project repository, but they should complement (not duplicate) the master guidelines. For example, a project might have specific brand colors or content guidelines, but should still reference the master SEO and UI guidelines for foundational principles.

How are updates to guidelines communicated?

When guidelines are updated in the master repository, projects should be notified via GitHub issues or pull requests. The workflow guidelines include processes for updating project documentation when master guidelines change.

Can I contribute to the guidelines?

Yes! The master instructions repository is open for contributions. Submit pull requests with improvements, and they'll be reviewed and merged. This ensures guidelines evolve based on real-world experience across all projects.

What about the 11ty website for these guidelines?

This repository includes an 11ty website that renders the guidelines as formatted web pages. The website is automatically deployed to AWS Amplify when changes are pushed to the main branch. You can view the live site at the Amplify URL.

Ready to Update Your Projects?

To update existing projects to reference master instructions:

"Remove local SEO/UI guideline files and add links to master instructions in your project documentation."

Your OpenClaw assistant can help update project documentation to reference these master guidelines.
